title: Unveiling Biases while Embracing Sustainability: Assessing the Dual Challenges of Automatic Speech Recognition Systems
author: Ajinkya Kulkarni (IDIAP, Switzerland), Atharva Kulkarni (Erisha Labs, India), Miguel Couceiro (Universite de Lorraine, CNRS, LORIA, Nancy, France), Isabel Trancoso (INESC-ID, IST, Universidade de Lisboa, Portugal)
relevance_why: This paper's examination of biases in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) systems and sustainability issues could inform similar evaluations in Dr. Liu's work on speech restoration and audio generation.
background: The paper investigates biases in ASR technologies related to demographic attributes while assessing their environmental impact, focusing on performance disparities and carbon footprint.
contribution: This paper introduces a comparative analysis of Whisper and Massively Multilingual Speech ASR systems to solve the problem of performance bias and sustainability, achieving insights into their efficacy in real-world scenarios.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous studies focused only on bias quantification or carbon emissions individually, lacking a comprehensive dual approach.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work provides a systematic evaluation addressing both bias and sustainability considerations, comparing performance across various demographic groups and utilizing multiple carbon tracking tools.

key_innovation: Offers an empirical analysis that integrates performance bias assessment with ecological impact metrics for ASR systems.
real_world_impact: The findings highlight the need for sustainable practices in AI that could lead to more equitable and environmentally conscious development of ASR technologies.

new_terms.Word Error Rate (WER): **Word Error Rate (WER)** is a common metric used to evaluate the accuracy of speech recognition systems, calculated as the ratio of incorrectly recognized words to the total number of words.
new_terms.Massively Multilingual Speech (MMS): **Massively Multilingual Speech (MMS)** refers to a learning project aimed at developing speech recognition technology across numerous languages.
